definitions.example: The battleship had three backwards guns at the stern, in addition to the primary complement.
The backwards lettering on emergency vehicles makes it possible to read in the rear-view mirror.
Modern medicine regards the use of leeches as a backwards practice.

definitions.definition: Clumsy, inept, or inefficient, especially in learning.
definitions.example: He was a very backwards scholar, but he was a marvel on the football field.
Life is lived forwards, but understood backwards.—Søren Kierkegaard

definitions.definition: In the opposite direction to usual.
definitions.example: The clock did not work because the battery was inserted backwards.

definitions.definition: In a manner such that the back precedes the front.
definitions.example: The tour guide walked backwards while droning on to the bored seniors.
